titleInfo.title: Col. David C. Chapman and Group on Summit of Mt. Chapman

mods.abstract: In the foreground is Col. David C. Chapman, dynamic leader in the movement that brought about establishment of the Great Smoky Mountains National Park. Others in the picture, from left to right, are Harvey B. Boome, Mrs. Charles W. Myers, Miss Mildred Query and Jas. E. Thompson, all members of the Great Smoky Mountains Conservation Association, of which Col. Chapman is President, and which organization started the movement for the Park's establishment. Col. Chapman is one of very few living men to have a major mountain peak named for him. It is still more unusual for the honoree to climb the peak after it was named for him.
